text:
330 ml bottle from Beergium, bottled 16/07/16.
Amber, hazy body, with a big, fluffy, lacing, white off-head.
Aroma of bread, dough, flowers, citrus, lemongrass, spices, some dried fruits, subtle sour fruits.
Tastes similar, with some more pine and although quite bitter, with more sweet notes.
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with ana verage carbonation.
Finishes bitter, medium dry, hoppy, very piney, floral, a bit bready, a bit yeasty, subtly sweet.

Very nice. Although my bottle is pretty old, still very hoppy, supported by a solid bready and yeasty body. Lovely pine spiciness towards the finish. Pretty diverse stuff, that reminds me a bit of De la Senne ales.
Bright orange. Murky. Large, relatively dense head. Aroma is spice and bread. Taste is fresh and lightly citric with a nice and dry hoppy finish.

hazy golden to orange colour, large, dense, slightly yellowish off-white head; aroma of orange zest oils, overripe peach, some tangerine, minimal tropical fruity and yeast notes; taste has the same notes with significant hoppy bitterness, malty sweetness and slight peppery notes; great Belgian ale!

0,33l bottle at home from Beergium. Bottled 16.07.2016. BB 16.07.2018. orange clear color, medium big white head. smells spices, bit yeasty, herbal, lemon grass, peppery, nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, tobacco, light cardboard, peppery, spices, grassy, citrus, lemon grass. finishes medium bitter with notes of lemon grass, citrus and peppery notes. quite decent but also a bit harsh, not my favourite belgian ale, too dominating bitterness, lacks some balance. overall still drinkable though.

Bottle at home. Peppery taste with hints of eucalyptus. Yeasty but hoppy fresh.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bue en bouteille de 75cl au beerlover de Liège
Couleur blonde, peu de mousse mais belle effervescence
Nez sur le fruit de la passion
Bière bien équilibrée avec une pointe houblonnée sur les agrumes et les fruits de la passion fin de bouche sur une pointe amère.
Bottle from Geers. Clear golden body with a medium white head. Hoppy, crackers, citrus, lime. Dry and bitter aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2016 Acheter à Tabac&co palais des bières dans famiflora à dottignies. Bouteille de 33 cl. Couleur cuivré orangée. Mousse abondante et crémeuse. Au nez c?est houblonné, agrumes fruitée, citron et citron vert ? En bouche c?est houblonné amertume douce agréable basé sur les agrumes , citron vert et citron , pamplemousse. Agrumes type citronnade et orangeade ! Rafraîchissant et agréable !Une bonne hoppy session.

dense ivorywhite ale. golden colour. aroma is hoppy, grapefruit, fruity. taste like aroma, wheat-like sour note, slight sweetness counterbalanced nicely by long bitter aftertaste. medium body and carbonation. well done, refreshing! bottle 33cl / bbf jul-2018
8 EBC. 55 IBU. Blond bier met witte schuimkraag. Geur: mout, hoppig, licht fruitig. Smaak: bitter, pompelmoes, citrus. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Iets romig mondgevoel. Afdronk: bitter, citrus

Bottle @ home. Hazy orange color, full sized white head that lasts for a decent while. Aroma is malts, hops, a nice fruity touch. Taste malts, hops, somewhat fruity bitter, quite bitter finish. Decent body, medium to firm carbonation. Quite decent.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2017 Bière blonde orange profonde opaque. Mousse abondante blanche, tenue moyenne. Nez puissant très prometteur sur les agrumes avec la suavité des fruits exotiques. Bouche houblonée très équilibrée et diverse : mandarine, pamplemousse, fruit de la passion, mangue, légèrement résineux. Matelas malté fin. Finale légèrement et moyenne longueur. Texture aqueuse, carbonatation moyenne. Très buvable et rafraîchissante sans être très sèche, corps fin, belle rondeur. Très belle "Belgian American PA" houblonnée dans les traces de la Senne ou autre Dochter vd korenaar.

33cl-fles van bij Bierhandel Willems te Grobbendonk U: troebel goud-oranje met gebroken witte schuimkraag G: perzik, tropisch fruit, citrus en ook wat pilsmout S: tropisch fruitige aanzet, gevolgd door citrusbitterheid. Nabitter in de afdronk met een kleine chemische toets. Mooie carbonatie.
750ml bottle in the garden, 23rd July 16. Pours a straw colour. The aroma is citrus, yeast, floral. Taste is aromatic and bitter, good citrus hops, some sweet honey. Very nice balance. Good stuff

Bouteille de 33 cl. Couleur dorée, mousse assez abondante, tenue moyenne. Des arômes de pamplemousses suivie d une belle amertume , peu complexe mais un bel équilibre. Carbonnation importante. Une bonne bière de soif dans l esprit d une Chouffe soleil. Trouvée à la brasserie Delneste - Froidmont.

Sample. Golden with big head. The bear has a strong aroma of American hops : tropical fruits and citrus. Plus there are grains, resin and a bit of dirty, wet laundry in the back. Medium body with medium strong carbonation. Juicy malts are quickly overpowered but bitter hops. Bitterness is lasting long and becoming a bit too much. Still very refreshing and I enjoy it in this hot weather.

Bottle shared. Very hazy golden orange with a medium off white head. Aroma of grass, weedy hops, green hops, citrus, light fruits and light malt. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle shared.
Thin white head. Hazy golden pour. Nice bitterness. Nice brew

Bottle shared thanks to UnknownStrangerNL. Hazy golden with fluffy white head. Light caramel, very grassy, bitter herbs, lemon peel, dry dusty grains. Under medium sweet and quite bitter. Medium bodied with full but fizzy carbonation.

Full 75cl easily downed during BE-HU. Bref: easier-going peach exotics on an XX Bitter framework. - Invitingly sweet-exotics nose of peach blossom, sweet tangerine, herbal notes, botanics. Thin malt biscuit sweetness meets baby Duvel carbonation: lively, crisp, summery. Urban saison yeast spice as an undercurrent, sustaining the grassy and botanical hop bitters, while tying in the foreign hop show with elegance. Makes sense in the modern pantheon of 21st century ales by De la Senne, De Ranke, Dochter vdK. - Overall a tasty crossover Belgian APA that I would prefer with a bit more body and less carbonation to session more often.

Bottle. Golden, almost amber, medium white head. Soft carbonation, little lacing. Aroma malts, green apples, hay. Fresh clean taste, first faintly sweet, then turning into bitter finish. Medium light body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bière. Pours light hazy orange yellow with a small, staying, frothy white head. Aroma has sweet malts, esters, apples, grapefruit hops, light wheat. Medium to high carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has fine crisp malts, serious bitterness, piney, grapefruit, citrus. Very nice, but could have been wonderful with some more dry hopping.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Belle blonde, belle mousse blanche. Nez houblon et levure. Grosse amertume, palais léger et très agréable. Faible corpulence. Pointe fruits exotiques, légère acidité finale. Excellente !
Bottle @ Willems Grobbendonk. Pours dark golden with a white head. Grass, melon, citrus and crackers. Refreshing, hoppy and dry. Lovely!

Clear dark golden color with a creamy white head. Nose is fruity, hoppy and citrusy. Body is medium, carbon fine. Taste is bitter. Palate is dominated by matured fruits, citruses, malts, and aromatic hops. Bitter finish. APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: wheat, fruity, fresh.
TASTE: wheat, fruity, fresh.

330ml bottle. Slightly cloudy, orangey golden colour with huge, thick, creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, white head. Rather cautious, minimally grainy, husky aroma, a touch of yeasty spiciness in minimally herbal and funky mode. Taste is minimally sweet malty, fruity, slightly husky, notes of yellow stone fruit, some citrus, moderate hop bitterness, cautious peppery yeasty spiciness, floral interludes. Superbly balanced, very refreshing, uncomplicated, catchy.

Misty golden body stable head. Soft citrus hops mixed in with soft sweet and cookie malts. Nice soft carbonation to get a fairly smooth appeal. Nice! Taste is more tangy, bitter, outspoken. Good stuff! (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

Robe blonde, reflets dorés. Nez sur des notes de houblon frais, légère note maltée, des épices, pointe citronnée. Bouche à lattaque fraîche, finement acidulée, très belle bulle et longue finale houblonnée. Une très belle bière de soif qui finit sur une belle amertume.

Hoppy blond ale, dixit le brasseur, que nous pourrions traduire par belgian ipa, évidemment,
sauf que ratebeer nous laisse la sempiternelle belgian ale 
Niveau abv de 6 % pour 12,9° plato, et 55 Ibu.
Malts pils, pale et aussi du malt de blé. Houblons galaxy et citra en normal et en dry hop.
Non filtrée, non pasteurisée, refermentée.
Mon exemplaire était à 17 mois de sa date limite, ce qui est très bien pour le brasseur qui 
demande expressément de ne pas la vieillir.
Couleur jaune abricot/pêche (8 ebc), avec un voile diaphane.
Bulles fines partout, à montée lente, pas très nombreuses.
Mousse qui est un nappage à flocons moyens, stable à 1 mm.
Arômes dagrumes, fruits blancs, fleurs blanches, pointe de camomille.
1ère bouche soyeuse au superbe ensemble malt/houblon.
Arrière-bouche dune amertume ciselée, très classe.
2ème à lensemble très équilibré et harmonieux.
Arrière-bouche dune amertume magnifique.
3ème à la texture superbe, et à lensemble houblonné avec le malt en rétro-nez. Très beau.
Arrière-bouche très harmonieuse, délicate.
Longueur pleine de nuances, et avec quelques notes de tanins.
Jambes fines, groupées.
Levure fine, fruitée, très belle ligne.
Alcool parfaitement à luvre, il tient le cap et développe lamertume.
Finale très fine.
CONCLUSION : super fresca bue super jeune donne super note sur le super site de ratebeer !!!

Light hazy yellow white colour, quite sour and hoppy, grass notes and a medium short finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

5th March 2016Hazy gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Palate is light, dry and has decent fine carbonation. Light malts, mildly sweet. Bitter floralness with a light soapy edge. Creamy malt sweetness emerges. Mild citrus and citric peel. Light finish. Bitter peel linger. Hangs together quite well apart from the soapy note. Strong bitterness here but the creamy malt sweetness holds it in check.

33cl bottle. Hazy golden colour with a thin white head. Apricots, citrus, orange peel, caramel and yeast in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is medium bitter, dry with some fruity notes. Overall, very refreshing as the name says.

Bottle and. Slightly hazy golden color with a medium thin foamy white head. Quite sour aroma of grain with notes of lemon. Medium sour taste with a bitter finish. Lively mouth feel.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

(Draught at Bier Circus, Brussels, 16 Oct 2015) Golden amber colour with frothy, off-white head. Malty, fruity nose with notes of citrus, orange peel, apricots and a touch of toast. Malty, fruity taste with citrus, orange peel, apricots, toast and a fresh, balanced citric bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Tasty and well balanced, with a fresh citric hop character. Nice one.

bottle oro carico velata buona schiuma piuttosto persistente discreto naso luppolato nota citrica ma anche erbacea terrosa media intensita cosi in bocca buona beva finale piacevolmente amaro luppolato

Bottle 750ml. [ As Tartaruga Super Fresca ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to light heavy grass, moderate to hoppy. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, grass, fruity, citrus, pale malt. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20151121]

330ml bottle from Beergium
BBE 04/08/17 - Pours clear golden with a thick foamy head. Aroma of stuffy fruitiness, yeast, caramely malts and hints tropical notes. Taste is smooth, a bit stuffy, carbonated and sweetish with some tropical fruits, hops, yeast and citrus. Finish is crisp, hoppy and slightly yeasty with some tropical notes and grass. Okay hoppy Belgian ale.

Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, yeast, sweet fruit, citrusly hops, grapefruit. Flavor is light sweet, malt, caramel, yeast, light honey, citrusly hops, grapefruit. Medium body, lively carbonation, light bitter finish. 231115

Bottle, 6%. Clear golden with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, yeast, hop and a little citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, yeast, little sweet, little grapefruit and medium bitter.
Yellow coloured and almost clear Has a white head, medium duration. Mostly hoppy.
Bottle. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter dry flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.
Bottle @ Højbjerg tasting, my house. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich fruits, yeast, hops, flowers, malt and has a pleasant bitter finish.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear golden with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 211115
Bottle from Geers. Hazy yellow colour, white foam. Nose of citrus and fresh grass. Bitter and dry with sweet hints. Refreshing and well balanced. Good!

Flaska från Beergium. Disig bärnstensfärgad vätska med medelhögt vitt skum. Riktigt fin frisk och fruktig doft, tropiskt frukt, citrus. Frisk och fruktig smak med påtaglig citrusbeska. Skulle kalla det här en belgisk IPA med betoning på IPA för så mycket belgisk karaktär finns inte men gott är det. Riktigt gott. Rena stora smaker, riktigt pigg fruktig humle med bra bett i beskan. Mums.

22/08/2015  sample (bottle) @ Gents Bierfestival shared with JorisPPattyn, Sebletitje, 77ships & PriorL
Hazy blond, medium head. Nose is citrus, hops. Taste is citrus, bitter, some sweetness
Sampled @ Gents Bierfestival 2015 Trübes goldenes Bier mit einer geringen weißen Schaumkrone. Der Geruch ist süß malzig, leicht hopfig fruchtig. Geschmack nach viel Malz, würzig, Honig, frisch.
Golden with lacy head. Aromas of yeast and hop. The flavour has a balanced hop bitterness and a slightly funky yeasty edge.

Sample @ 6de Gents Bierfestival 2015.
Couleur orangée, col blanc-cassé.
Arôme offre un bouquet houblonné frais assez prenant et tirant sur de fines pointes dagrumes - retrouve un côté américain houblonné type C.
Malt reste présent perce en rétro et apporte une pointe grains - carapils et pâle.
Palais est légèrement malté avec ici une approche plus belge. Houblonné reste cependant le point fort et tjrs une marque centrée sur des agrumes, ici une fine note pamplemousse. Fini est sec, possible houblonnage à cru?, et au final un résultat convaincant dune IPA-belge.

15cl sample at the Ghent Beer Festival VI (22 VIII 2015). Bright orange brew with a small white collar on top. Insane good smelling beer: Aromas of citrus and hops, even some pear hints. Beautiful and very promising. Halas, the taste cannot compete with the aromas. Think of a lighter bodied De Ranke XX Bitter, with hay or maybe mint features. The bitterness is powerful, yet the finish is a not really convincing.
Mild bitterer Antrunk, etwas herb, trocken hefig. Mit der Zeit wirkt das Bier komplexer, die Trockenheit bleibt aber vorhanden. Okay. 11/10/10/9//10

Huge, lacy and fluffy just off-white head over hazy but bright orange beer. C-hops, but also EU herbal hops, garden weeds, peach, lunaria. Bitterish, toasted malts, even some fiery notes - hops gone? Medium bodied, well-carbonated. Not very impressed.
Bottle. Pours bit unclear blonde, small white head. Smell is citrussy, taste is bitter, and elegant citrus hops. Very easy drinkable and refreshing
Bottle bought at Geers. Lemon, cheesy, pleasant bitterness, very easty to drink, very nice beer, fruity hops.
Dorée voilée, effervescence très légère de visu, moyenne-légère au palais, col blanc moyen. Malt pils entre autres, amertume (40 EBU) de pamplemousse, légèrement fruitée, porte bien son nom.

75 cl bottle @ Timo A. Thanks lusikka!
Pours hazy golden color with a small head. Very fruity aroma, some herbs, mild yeast and lots of hops. Flavor is lemony, very hoppy, gooseberries and some grassy notes, mild yeast on the background. Strong carbonation, very crisp and refreshing. Not what I was expecting from a Belgian Ale, nice.
3424

750 ml bottle. Courtesy of lusikka.
Slightly cloudy color with a small white head. 
Fruity hops, mild bitterness, sweetness and tropical fruits in the aroma. The tropical fruitiness is really yummy! 
The flavor is fruity hops, tropical fruits, tea, mild bitterness and malt. A bit thin. Very tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden colour with a small foamy head. Complex aroma of rich juicy floral hops, citrus, peach and herbal notes. Flavour of crisp floral bitterness, pineapple, citrus, rich herbal notes, mild graininess and smooth wheaty notes. Medium bodied. Crisp and juicy. Very refreshing.
Bottle 75cl shared with Fabien G. @ Le Barboteur. Nice bitterness, notes of citrus, lemon. Very well balanced, refreshing. Nice surprise!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2016 First beer from a new beer company, from a 75 cl bottle which is hopefully still super fresh (a bottle date would come in handy if freshness is such a big deal here!). Lightly hazy, pretty and warm light orange blonde colour with vivid sparkling, supporting a thick, moussy, dense, off-white head thickly lacing on the edges of the glass. Lovely (and flawless!) hoppy and fruity aroma of tangerine, lychee, mojito, acacia honey, a basket of spring flowers, lemon zest, cantelope, fresh apple cake, strawberry, vanilla, biscuit. Refreshing, crisp onset, peach, pineapple and redcurrant, strongish, finely tingling carbo with a highly quenching mineral water effect without becoming overcarbonated; spicy hop bitterness is at that point already showing at the horizon, only to increase in strength towards the finish where, aided by a light but pleasant, slightly nutty maltiness, it achieves a long, dry, resinous, spicy bitter finish, bittering, but very aromatic, floral and citrussy as well. Adding the yeast deposit lends it an obviously yeastier, more powdery mouthfeel, but the aroma and overall flavour remain just as fresh.  Cleaner than I expected, with far less of the overly yeasty character of many artisanal Belgian ales, with a lush and overwhelming hop profile: this is not just any Belgian ale, this is not even a Belgian IPA, this is (almost) a genuine, perfectly balanced, fine-tuned, American style IPA, juicy, extremely thirst quenching and totally refreshing on the longest day of the year... I would never have identified this as being Belgian if I had tasted this blind. A new Belgian brewer who looks forward instead of backward like most others, hopefully this can inspire many others. Highly recommended!

What is this a great beer ! Bought @ Willems.
Almost clear darkgolden to copper color, big creamy white head.
 Aroma: fruits from used hops, passion, citrus, sweet touch. Medium body. Taste: some soft sweet start, fruits, citrus, passion, malts, bitter, loverly hops. Pleasant bitterness, citrus.
GOOD !

UPDATED: APR 24, 2016 Bière blonde au corps légèrement cuivré présentant un beau col fin persistant. Après 6 mois de cave, dès le 1re gorgée, le citra agresse moins le palais à lattaque au profit dun maltage panifié légèrement biscuité plus doux. Cette rondeur et ce bel houblonnage citronné descendent en équilibre dans le gosier avec ravissement. Saveurs résineuses du Galaxy agréables en arrière-goût. Quant à la levure elle apporte un peu côté poivré pas inintéressant.

Bottle from Geers.
Pours a clear blond beer with a big white head.
Smell is hoppy, exotic fruits, citrus, lychee.
Tastes bitter.
Leaves a full hoppy aftertaste!
Great refreshing beer!

750 ml. bottle @ home. Purchased @ Willems & Zoon. BBF 09/02/17. New Belgian contract brewery, brewed @ De Ranke hence my interest. Label lists cracker as a suggested food pairing, lol, isnt that basically a food pairing for every beer? Hazy lemon golden, creamy white head. Nose is very interesting white grape, big lemon, kiwi, faint cheese, faintly cheese & fruity yeast, fruity hoppy, very light yeast & sweetish pineapple, very nice & interesting. Taste is light pine apple, nicely hoppy, great balance for ABV with light complimentary yeast (rare for BE beers, way, way too rare), white grape, lightly sweetish but light body compensates nicely, white grape, faint white pepper, touch white bread, easy to drink not overly outspoken but that makes it easier to drink plus it is very well-balanced. There is also fruity grapefruit & touch of grass, Very nice beer, I applaud De Ranke for this work. This isnt the most amazing beer ever but it is a great showcase of balance, restraint, fruity hops, character & drinkability for what is a low ABV by Belgian standards. I really love their beers & probably should revisit & re-evaluate some of them since some ratings date from my earliest days & XX Bitter is pretty much the only one I drink regularly.

27/III/15 - 75cl bottle from Willems (Grobbendonk) @ home - BB: n/a (2015-403)  Thanks to Ben for picking this one up for me!
Little hazy orange beer, big creamy white head, little stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: lots of citrus, fruity, pineapple, passion fruits, bit sweet. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of citrus, grapefruit, bitter, little sweet, very fruity, lots of passion fruits. Aftertaste: soft bitterness, citrus, lots of pineapple, grapefruit, little grassy, malty touch, grains, very nice!

Blonde à la mousse blanche. Arômes chargés de notes houblonnées sur les agrumes et fruits exotiques (ananas, mangue, fruits de la passion), très agréable. La saveur est encore mieux. Extrêmement nette et propre. Houblon sur le zeste dagrumes enrobé dune légère douceur maltée. Des notes de mandarine, ananas, et un peu de mangue. Cest un assemblage dagrumes tropicales douces-amères avec beaucoup de sensations végétales (dry hopping). Belle texture en bouche, 6% sans aucun signe de lalcool. Au final, belle amertume avec une touche de lime, fruit de la passion. Excellente bière.
